pr_title: Change `upload-url` Command to Assume Datasource URL from Environment Variable

timeline.message: Include datasourceUrl in validate() error message; Include error message in test
Change `upload-url` command to assume datasource URL from env var
Remove tests already covered by ValidatesRecordingName
Move datasource URL checking to validate() and isAvailable()
Use Apache Commons UrlValidator instead of java.net.URL for uploadUrl validation
Include datasourceUrl in validate() error message; Include error message in test
Make changes for validate PR rebase
Make changes for validate PR rebase

timeline.bodyText: Does this work if the user sets the env var to ex. http://localhost:8080/, with a trailing slash?
timeline.author: andrewazores

replies.bodyText: Yes, tested just now and it works.
replies.author: vic-ma

replies.bodyText: Cool. I thought a double-slash might break things, since it could be interpreted as a null or empty string as the first path segment. If the Vertx webclient and the jfr-datasource both accept this then no worries.
replies.author: andrewazores

replies.bodyText: Yeah, when I was working on the web client I had a trailing slash at first and I noticed that even though the logs said it was uploading to http://localhost:8080//load which seemed like it'd break for sure, it was working. I guess it's cool that that works; makes stuff like this a lot easier.
replies.author: vic-ma

replies.bodyText:
It isn't too hard to clean it up anyway. There are cleaner ways using URIBuilder and such, but with just plain JDK (and ContainerJFR) classes:
new URL(env.getEnv(GRAFANA_DATASOURCE_ENV)).toURI().resolve("/load").normalize().toString()
should do it.
replies.author: andrewazores
